instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> critical software
threads.message:
hello got this with critical software update. board is clean.
can boot into safemode. 
i think customer having this issue after he software update.
i tried format and install via bootable drive (catalina) still same issue.
i tried good known working topcase and reinstall os is the same.
based on this [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/macbook-pro-15-inch-2017-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-only-boots-safe-mode-critical-update-bootloop-no-visible-damage.61220/[/URL]
probably the same issue. if yes can u give mi clean bios?
if not is there something that i can do?
thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> critical software
threads.message:
No feedback on that thread, so no idea if BIOS helped him.
Try this file:

i tried use my usb bootable installer it says:
your computer is disabled try again 59minutes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> critical software
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> critical software
threads.message:
after did pram reset able to reinstall os again 
but still having critical software issue. 
what to do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> critical software
threads.message:
Inspect connectors and board area related with touchbar.
Maybe knocked off component, or broken trace; pay atention to small series coils from data lines.
